title: Worldbuilding Goals Worksheet
description: Defines specific worldbuilding goals including what elements must be created, what is optional, time commitments, and priority ordering. Helps prevent overwhelm by establishing clear scope boundaries and a creation order.

primary_goal.description: The primary reason for building this world

time_commitment.description: How many hours per week can be dedicated to worldbuilding

patience_level.description: How long are you willing to spend before the world is 'usable'?

approach.description: Primary creation approach: top-down (continent first), bottom-up (details first), random (as inspiration strikes), or mixed (recommended)

required_elements.description: Elements that MUST be created for the world to function (e.g., 'sovereign powers', 'magic system', 'species', 'settlements')

optional_elements.description: Elements that would enrich the world but are not strictly required

excluded_elements.description: Elements intentionally excluded from this worldbuilding effort (e.g., 'conlang', 'space travel', 'undead')

priority_order.description: Ordered list of elements from highest to lowest priority for creation

first_story_needs.description: Specific elements needed for the first planned story or campaign

depth.description: How deeply this element will be developed

depth_targets.description: Target depth for each major worldbuilding element

review_frequency.description: How often to review and reassess goals

notes.description: Freeform notes on goals and priorities

x-cross-references.world-building-strategy: Goals should align with the strategic decisions made in the Strategy Worksheet
x-cross-references.file-organization: The file organization should reflect the priority order defined here
x-cross-references.review-schedule: The review schedule template tracks ongoing review of these goals
